DOC.brief_title: Identifying Progression Retinal Disease Eyes With NPDR Diabetes Type 2 Using Non-invasive Procedures
DOC.detailed_description: To identify `` progressors '' retinal vascular disease central retinal edema type 2 diabetic patient early NPDR , base retinal disease progression baseline 12-month visit , assess follow biomarkers : - Microaneurysms turnover ( MA formation rate equal 2 , i.e . number new MA baseline 12-month visit ) compute color fundus photograph use RetmarkerDR software ; - Retinal thickness increase eye retinal thickening ( Increase retinal thickness normal range ) central subfield , inner ring and/or outer ring Constantly Present , Present Absent ( measure OCT consider macula thickness normative data .
DOC.criteria: 1 . Diabetes type 2 accord 1985 WHO criteria 2 . Age 35 75 year 3 . Mild nonproliferative diabetic retinopathy ( level 20 35 , base ETDRS criterion ) 7 field color fundus photography 4 . Presence least 1 microaneurysm central 3000 micr . diameter area ( correspond 2 DA ) Field 2 5 . Best Corrected Visual Acuity > = 75 letter ( > = 20 /32 ) 6 . Refraction spherical equivalent le 5 Dp 7 . Informed consent 1 . Cataract eye disease may interfere fundus examination 2 . Glaucoma 3 . Any eye surgery within period 6months 4 . Other retinal vascular disease 5 . Previous laser therapy 6 . Dilatation pupil < 5 mm
